means: [俚]吸毒（成瘾）者；颓废派成员；性变态者

[俚语]（像吸过毒似的）行为反常
[俚语]使采取不合常规的生活方式
[俚语]使处于幻觉剂影响之下

encyclopedia.content: 专辑中文名: Freak 歌手: MEG 音乐风格: 电子 版本: 单曲 发行时间: 2009年2月11日 地区: 日本 语言: 日语 专辑介绍： 2009年MEG的第一首单曲——『Freak』！MEG不管是在造型上，还是音乐的曲风上都带来一点惊喜！以前一直留着很像yuki的长发的MEG，现在剪啦一头短短的西瓜头（不知道形容准不准确），感觉有几分想椎名林檎。其次，这次的『Freak』继承啦以前的电子风格以外，还加入啦舞曲的元素，尤其是第一首freak,甜美的嗓音带有

entry.def: A freak event or action is one that is a very unusual or extreme example of its type.

example.ex: Weir broke his leg in a freak accident playing golf...
example.tran: 韦尔因为一次打高尔夫时发生的离奇事故折断了腿。

example.ex: The ferry was hit by a freak wave off the North Wales coast.
example.tran: 渡船在北威尔士海岸附近被一股反常的海浪击中。

entry.def: If you describe someone as a particular kind of freak, you are emphasizing that they are very enthusiastic about a thing or activity, and often seem to think about nothing else.

example.ex: Oat bran became the darling of health freaks last year.
example.tran: 燕麦麸在去年成为保健狂人的最爱。

entry.def: People are sometimes referred to as freaks when their behaviour or attitude is very different from that of the majority of people.

example.ex: However, outside of these institutions the black thinking woman is looked upon as a freak...
example.tran: 然而，在这些机构之外，有思想的黑人女性被当作怪胎看待。

example.ex: Not so long ago, transsexuals were regarded as freaks.
example.tran: 不久前变性人还被视为怪物。

entry.tran: 畸形(人)(可能具冒犯意味)
entry.def: If you refer to someone as a freak, you mean that they are physically abnormal in some way. This use could cause offence.

entry.tran: (使)吃惊;(使)不安;(使)恼怒;(使)困惑
entry.def: If someone freaks, or if something freaks them, they suddenly feel extremely surprised, upset, angry, or confused.

example.ex: I saw five cop cars pull into the driveway. And I literally freaked...
example.tran: 我看到 5 辆警车开进了我家的车道。我简直吓坏了。

example.ex: I think they got freaked by women laughing at them.
example.tran: 我想他们被那些嘲笑他们的女人搞得不知所措了。

entry.tran: (使)吃惊;(使)不安;(使)恼怒;(使)困惑
entry.def: If someone freaks out, or if something freaks them out, they suddenly feel extremely surprised, upset, angry, or confused.

example.ex: I remember the first time I went onstage. I freaked out completely...
example.tran: 我还记得自己第一次登台的情形。我完全吓坏了。

example.ex: I think our music freaks people out sometimes...
example.tran: 我想我们的音乐有时会吓着大家。

means.word_mean: 1. a person or animal that is markedly unusual or deformed
2. someone who is so ardently devoted to something that it resembles an addiction;

sentences.sentence: "When he saw the accident, he freaked out"

example.en: Ernie used to be a kick freak, but all that has changed.
example.zh: 欧尼过去是一个吸毒没有瘾的人，但后来全不是那么回事，都变样了。

auth_sentence.content: This has also been picked up by Torrent Freak.
auth_sentence.res_content: This has also been picked up by Torrent Freak.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This has also been picked up by Torrent Freak.

auth_sentence.content: Freak weather conditions are a constant headache for skippers.
auth_sentence.res_content: Freak weather conditions are a constant headache for skippers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Freak weather conditions are a constant headache for skippers.

auth_sentence.content: Chaos theory by definition cannot predict freak events.
auth_sentence.res_content: Chaos theory by definition cannot predict freak events.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Chaos theory by definition cannot predict freak events.

sentences.en: By some freak of fate, she won an enormous sum of money.
sentences.cn: 她不知交了什么好运，赢了一大笔钱。

means.word_mean: 有怪癖的人, 奇形怪状的人

sentences.en: I was born with black hair all over my back,like some sort of freak.
sentences.cn: 我出生时满背黑毛,就像个怪物。

sentences.en: For the real speed freak, there is a 2-litre, fuel-injection version of the car.
sentences.cn: 对于那些玩命追求极速的车迷，有种2 升、燃料喷射的车型。

sentences.en: A driver was killed in a freak accident when a cow fell from a bridge.
sentences.cn: 一名司机在一起由一头奶牛掉下桥而引起的怪异事故中丧生了。

sentences.en: A freak wave washed the two children away.
sentences.cn: 突如其来的浪头把两个孩子卷走了。

sentences.en: I don’t know what happened in the exams.I just freaked out.
sentences.cn: 我不知道考试是如何过来的。我完全吓懵了。

sentences.en: I thought I’d seen a ghost — it really freaked me out.
sentences.cn: 我当时以为见到了鬼─我大惊失色。
